function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Correlation between socioeconomic status and access to green areas","Impact":"Unequal access to green areas can impact public health and exacerbate existing health disparities.","Mitigation":"Implement policies and programs to ensure equal access to green areas regardless of socioeconomic status.","Technologies":"Urban planning tools, GIS mapping, community engagement strategies","People":"Communities with lower socioeconomic status","Owner":"Local government, urban planners, community organizations"},{"Description":"Changes in access to green areas due to the pandemic","Impact":"Limited access to green areas can negatively impact mental and physical health during a time of crisis.","Mitigation":"Promote remote access to green spaces, implement safety measures for in-person visits, and provide alternative outdoor recreation options.","Technologies":"Virtual reality technology, online park reservations, social distancing monitoring tools","People":"General public, especially those in urban areas","Owner":"Public health agencies, local governments, urban planners"},{"Description":"Inequities and exclusions in access to green areas during the pandemic","Impact":"Increased disparities in access to green spaces can further exacerbate health and social inequities among different communities.","Mitigation":"Conduct targeted outreach, implement inclusive park design, and provide financial support for disadvantaged communities to access green areas.","Technologies":"Community engagement platforms, mobile health apps, equity mapping tools","People":"Marginalized and disadvantaged communities","Owner":"Public health agencies, community organizations, urban planners"}]}
